docs.title: DIST-S1 Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome! This site documents the DIST-S1 package.

  • See API pages for auto-generated tables from Pydantic models.

docs.title: Algorithm Configuration Model
docs.text:
This should show the RunConfigData table below.

Base class containing algorithm configuration parameters.

Show JSON schema: 
{
  "description": "Base class containing algorithm configuration parameters.",
  "properties": {
    "device": {
      "default": "best",
      "description": "Device to use for model inference. `best` will use the best available device.",
      "pattern": "^(best|cuda|mps|cpu)$",
      "title": "Device",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "memory_strategy": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "pattern": "^(high|low)$",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": "high",
      "description": "Memory strategy to use for model inference. `high` will use more memory, `low` will use less. Utilizing more memory will improve runtime performance.",
      "title": "Memory Strategy"
    },
    "tqdm_enabled": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to enable tqdm progress bars.",
      "title": "Tqdm Enabled",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 8,
      "description": "Number of workers for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory. Does not work with model compilation or MPS/GPU devices.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "N Workers For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 32,
      "description": "Batch size for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger batch size will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "Batch Size For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "stride_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 16,
      "description": "Stride for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger stride will improve metric accuracy and utilize more memory.Memory usage scales inverse quadratically with stride. That is, If stride=16 consumes N bytes of memory, then stride=4 consumes 16N bytes of memory.",
      "maximum": 16,
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "Stride For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "apply_logit_to_inputs": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to apply logit transform to the input data.",
      "title": "Apply Logit To Inputs",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_workers_for_despeckling": {
      "default": 8,
      "description": "Number of workers for despeckling. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "N Workers For Despeckling",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "lookback_strategy": {
      "default": "multi_window",
      "description": "Lookback strategy to use for data curation of the baseline. `multi_window` will use a multi-window lookback strategy and is default for OEPRA DIST-S1, `immediate_lookback` will use an immediate lookback strategy using acquisitions preceding the post-date. `immediate_lookback` is not supported yet.",
      "pattern": "^multi_window$",
      "title": "Lookback Strategy",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "post_date_buffer_days": {
      "default": 1,
      "description": "Buffer days around post-date for data collection to create acqusition image to compare baseline to.",
      "maximum": 7,
      "minimum": 0,
      "title": "Post Date Buffer Days",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "model_compilation": {
      "default": false,
      "description": "Whether to compile the model for CPU or GPU. False, use the model as is. True, load the model and compile for CPU or GPU optimizations.",
      "title": "Model Compilation",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "items": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "type": "array"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Max number of pre-images per burst within each window",
      "title": "Max Pre Imgs Per Burst Mw"
    },
    "delta_lookback_days_mw": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "items": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "type": "array"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Delta lookback days for each window relative to post-image acquisition date",
      "title": "Delta Lookback Days Mw"
    },
    "low_confidence_alert_threshold": {
      "default": 3.5,
      "description": "Low confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
      "maximum": 15.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "title": "Low Confidence Alert Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "high_confidence_alert_threshold": {
      "default": 5.5,
      "description": "High confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
      "maximum": 15.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "title": "High Confidence Alert Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "no_day_limit": {
      "default": 30,
      "description": "Number of days to limit confirmation process logic to. Confirmation must occur within first observance of disturbance and `no_day_limit` days after first disturbance.",
      "title": "No Day Limit",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "exclude_consecutive_no_dist": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Boolean activation of consecutive no disturbance tracking during confirmation. True will apply this logic: after 2 no disturbances within product sequence, the disturbance must finish or be reset. False will not apply this logic.",
      "title": "Exclude Consecutive No Dist",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "percent_reset_thresh": {
      "default": 10,
      "description": "Precentage number threshold to reset disturbance. Values below `percent_reset_thresh` will reset disturbance.",
      "title": "Percent Reset Thresh",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "no_count_reset_thresh": {
      "default": 7,
      "description": "If the number of non-disturbed observations `prevnocount` is above `nocount_reset_thresh` disturbance will reset.",
      "title": "No Count Reset Thresh",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "max_obs_num_year": {
      "default": 253,
      "description": "Max observation number per year. If observations exceeds this number, then the confirmation must conclude and be reset.",
      "title": "Max Obs Num Year",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "confidence_upper_lim": {
      "default": 32000,
      "description": "Confidence upper limit for confirmation. Confidence is an accumulation of the metric over time.",
      "title": "Confidence Upper Lim",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "confirmation_confidence_threshold": {
      "default": 31.5,
      "description": "This is the threshold for the confirmation process to determine if a disturbance is confirmed.",
      "title": "Confirmation Confidence Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "metric_value_upper_lim": {
      "default": 100.0,
      "description": "Metric upper limit set during confirmation",
      "title": "Metric Value Upper Lim",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "model_source": {
      "default": "transformer_optimized",
      "description": "Model source. If `external`, use externally supplied paths for weights and config. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Source",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "model_cfg_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to model config file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Cfg Path"
    },
    "model_wts_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to model weights file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Wts Path"
    },
    "apply_despeckling": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to apply despeckling to the input data.",
      "title": "Apply Despeckling",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "interpolation_method": {
      "default": "bilinear",
      "description": "Interpolation method to use for despeckling. `nearest` will use nearest neighbor interpolation, `bilinear` will use bilinear interpolation, and `none` will not apply despeckling.",
      "pattern": "^(nearest|bilinear|none)$",
      "title": "Interpolation Method",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "model_dtype": {
      "default": "float32",
      "description": "Data type for model inference. Note: bfloat16 is only supported on GPU devices.",
      "pattern": "^(float32|bfloat16|float)$",
      "title": "Model Dtype",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "use_date_encoding": {
      "default": false,
      "description": "Whether to use acquisition date encoding in model application (currently not supported)",
      "title": "Use Date Encoding",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_anniversaries_for_mw": {
      "default": 3,
      "description": "Number of anniversaries to use for multi-window",
      "title": "N Anniversaries For Mw",
      "type": "integer"
    }
  },
  "title": "AlgoConfigData",
  "type": "object"
}

Config:

  • validate_assignment: True

Fields:

  • device (str)
  • memory_strategy (str | None)
  • tqdm_enabled (bool)
  • n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation (int)
  • batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation (int)
  • stride_for_norm_param_estimation (int)
  • apply_logit_to_inputs (bool)
  • n_workers_for_despeckling (int)
  • lookback_strategy (str)
  • post_date_buffer_days (int)
  • model_compilation (bool)
  • max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw (tuple[int, ...] | None)
  • delta_lookback_days_mw (tuple[int, ...] | None)
  • low_confidence_alert_threshold (float)
  • high_confidence_alert_threshold (float)
  • no_day_limit (int)
  • exclude_consecutive_no_dist (int)
  • percent_reset_thresh (int)
  • no_count_reset_thresh (int)
  • max_obs_num_year (int)
  • confidence_upper_lim (int)
  • confirmation_confidence_threshold (float)
  • metric_value_upper_lim (float)
  • model_source (str)
  • model_cfg_path (Path | str | None)
  • model_wts_path (Path | str | None)
  • apply_despeckling (bool)
  • interpolation_method (str)
  • model_dtype (str)
  • use_date_encoding (bool)
  • _model_context_length (int | None)
  • n_anniversaries_for_mw (int)

Validators:

  • validate_memory_strategy → memory_strategy
  • validate_device → device
  • validate_n_workers → n_workers_for_despeckling, n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation
  • convert_list_to_tuple → max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw, delta_lookback_days_mw
  • validate_low_confidence_alert_threshold → low_confidence_alert_threshold
  • validate_model_dtype → model_dtype
  • validate_model_cfg_path → model_cfg_path
  • validate_model_wts_path → model_wts_path
  • validate_model_compilation_device_compatibility
  • validate_model_dtype_device_compatibility
  • handle_device_specific_validations
  • calculate_max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw
  • calculate_delta_lookback_days_mw

docs.title: device: str = DEFAULT_DEVICE pydantic-field
docs.text: Device to use for model inference. best will use the best available device.

docs.title: memory_strategy: str | None = DEFAULT_MEMORY_STRATEGY pydantic-field
docs.text: Memory strategy to use for model inference. high will use more memory, low will use less. Utilizing more memory will improve runtime performance.

docs.title: tqdm_enabled: bool = DEFAULT_TQDM_ENABLED pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to enable tqdm progress bars.

docs.title: n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_N_WORKERS_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of workers for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory. Does not work with model compilation or MPS/GPU devices.

docs.title: batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Batch size for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger batch size will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.

docs.title: stride_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_STRIDE_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Stride for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger stride will improve metric accuracy and utilize more memory.Memory usage scales inverse quadratically with stride. That is, If stride=16 consumes N bytes of memory, then stride=4 consumes 16N bytes of memory.

docs.title: apply_logit_to_inputs: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_LOGIT_TO_INPUTS pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply logit transform to the input data.

docs.title: n_workers_for_despeckling: int = DEFAULT_N_WORKERS_FOR_DESPECKLING pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of workers for despeckling. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.

docs.title: lookback_strategy: str = DEFAULT_LOOKBACK_STRATEGY pydantic-field
docs.text: Lookback strategy to use for data curation of the baseline. multi_window will use a multi-window lookback strategy and is default for OEPRA DIST-S1, immediate_lookback will use an immediate lookback strategy using acquisitions preceding the post-date. immediate_lookback is not supported yet.

docs.title: post_date_buffer_days: int = DEFAULT_POST_DATE_BUFFER_DAYS pydantic-field
docs.text: Buffer days around post-date for data collection to create acqusition image to compare baseline to.

docs.title: model_compilation: bool = DEFAULT_MODEL_COMPILATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to compile the model for CPU or GPU. False, use the model as is. True, load the model and compile for CPU or GPU optimizations.

docs.title: max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw: tuple[int, ...] | None = DEFAULT_MAX_PRE_IMGS_PER_BURST_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Max number of pre-images per burst within each window

docs.title: delta_lookback_days_mw: tuple[int, ...] | None = DEFAULT_DELTA_LOOKBACK_DAYS_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Delta lookback days for each window relative to post-image acquisition date

docs.title: low_confidence_alert_threshold: float = DEFAULT_LOW_CONFIDENCE_ALERT_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: Low confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.

docs.title: high_confidence_alert_threshold: float = DEFAULT_HIGH_CONFIDENCE_ALERT_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: High confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.

docs.title: no_day_limit: int = DEFAULT_NO_DAY_LIMIT pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of days to limit confirmation process logic to. Confirmation must occur within first observance of disturbance and no_day_limit days after first disturbance.

docs.title: exclude_consecutive_no_dist: int = DEFAULT_EXCLUDE_CONSECUTIVE_NO_DIST pydantic-field
docs.text: Boolean activation of consecutive no disturbance tracking during confirmation. True will apply this logic: after 2 no disturbances within product sequence, the disturbance must finish or be reset. False will not apply this logic.

docs.title: percent_reset_thresh: int = DEFAULT_PERCENT_RESET_THRESH pydantic-field
docs.text: Precentage number threshold to reset disturbance. Values below percent_reset_thresh will reset disturbance.

docs.title: no_count_reset_thresh: int = DEFAULT_NO_COUNT_RESET_THRESH pydantic-field
docs.text: If the number of non-disturbed observations prevnocount is above nocount_reset_thresh disturbance will reset.

docs.title: max_obs_num_year: int = DEFAULT_MAX_OBS_NUM_YEAR pydantic-field
docs.text: Max observation number per year. If observations exceeds this number, then the confirmation must conclude and be reset.

docs.title: confidence_upper_lim: int = DEFAULT_CONFIDENCE_UPPER_LIM pydantic-field
docs.text: Confidence upper limit for confirmation. Confidence is an accumulation of the metric over time.

docs.title: confirmation_confidence_threshold: float = DEFAULT_CONFIRMATION_CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: This is the threshold for the confirmation process to determine if a disturbance is confirmed.

docs.title: metric_value_upper_lim: float = DEFAULT_METRIC_VALUE_UPPER_LIM pydantic-field
docs.text: Metric upper limit set during confirmation

docs.title: model_source: str = DEFAULT_MODEL_SOURCE pydantic-field
docs.text: Model source. If external, use externally supplied paths for weights and config. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: model_cfg_path: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_MODEL_CFG_PATH pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to model config file. If external, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: model_wts_path: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_MODEL_WTS_PATH pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to model weights file. If external, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: apply_despeckling: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_DESPECKLING pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply despeckling to the input data.

docs.title: interpolation_method: str = DEFAULT_INTERPOLATION_METHOD pydantic-field
docs.text: Interpolation method to use for despeckling. nearest will use nearest neighbor interpolation, bilinear will use bilinear interpolation, and none will not apply despeckling.

docs.title: model_dtype: str = DEFAULT_MODEL_DTYPE pydantic-field
docs.text: Data type for model inference. Note: bfloat16 is only supported on GPU devices.

docs.title: use_date_encoding: bool = DEFAULT_USE_DATE_ENCODING pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to use acquisition date encoding in model application (currently not supported)

docs.title: n_anniversaries_for_mw: int = DEFAULT_N_ANNIVERSARIES_FOR_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of anniversaries to use for multi-window

docs.title: from_yaml(yaml_file: str | Path) -> AlgoConfigData classmethod
docs.text: Load algorithm configuration from a YAML file.

docs.title: validate_device(device: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate and set the device. None or 'none' will be converted to the default device.

docs.title: convert_list_to_tuple(v: list[int] | None) -> tuple[int, ...] | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert lists to tuples for YAML compatibility.

docs.title: serialize_tuple_as_list(v: tuple[int, ...] | None) -> list[int] | None
docs.text: Serialize tuples as lists for YAML compatibility.

docs.title: validate_low_confidence_alert_threshold(low_confidence_alert_threshold: float, info: ValidationInfo) -> float pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that low_confidence_alert_threshold is less than high_confidence_alert_threshold.

docs.title: validate_model_dtype(model_dtype: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_dtype is a supported data type.

docs.title: validate_model_cfg_path(model_cfg_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_cfg_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_model_wts_path(model_wts_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_wts_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_model_compilation_device_compatibility() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_compilation is not True when device is 'mps'.

docs.title: validate_model_dtype_device_compatibility() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Warn when bfloat16 is used with non-GPU devices.

docs.title: handle_device_specific_validations() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Handle device-specific validations and adjustments.

docs.title: calculate_max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Calculate max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw if not provided.

docs.title: calculate_delta_lookback_days_mw() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Calculate delta_lookback_days_mw if not provided.

docs.title: to_yml(yaml_file: str | Path) -> None
docs.text: Save algorithm configuration to a YAML file.

docs.title: Run Configuration Model
docs.text:
This page documents the main Pydantic model used for configuring a DIST-S1 run.

Show JSON schema: 
{
  "$defs": {
    "AlgoConfigData": {
      "description": "Base class containing algorithm configuration parameters.",
      "properties": {
        "device": {
          "default": "best",
          "description": "Device to use for model inference. `best` will use the best available device.",
          "pattern": "^(best|cuda|mps|cpu)$",
          "title": "Device",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "memory_strategy": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "pattern": "^(high|low)$",
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "null"
            }
          ],
          "default": "high",
          "description": "Memory strategy to use for model inference. `high` will use more memory, `low` will use less. Utilizing more memory will improve runtime performance.",
          "title": "Memory Strategy"
        },
        "tqdm_enabled": {
          "default": true,
          "description": "Whether to enable tqdm progress bars.",
          "title": "Tqdm Enabled",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation": {
          "default": 8,
          "description": "Number of workers for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory. Does not work with model compilation or MPS/GPU devices.",
          "minimum": 1,
          "title": "N Workers For Norm Param Estimation",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation": {
          "default": 32,
          "description": "Batch size for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger batch size will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
          "minimum": 1,
          "title": "Batch Size For Norm Param Estimation",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "stride_for_norm_param_estimation": {
          "default": 16,
          "description": "Stride for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger stride will improve metric accuracy and utilize more memory.Memory usage scales inverse quadratically with stride. That is, If stride=16 consumes N bytes of memory, then stride=4 consumes 16N bytes of memory.",
          "maximum": 16,
          "minimum": 1,
          "title": "Stride For Norm Param Estimation",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "apply_logit_to_inputs": {
          "default": true,
          "description": "Whether to apply logit transform to the input data.",
          "title": "Apply Logit To Inputs",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "n_workers_for_despeckling": {
          "default": 8,
          "description": "Number of workers for despeckling. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
          "minimum": 1,
          "title": "N Workers For Despeckling",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "lookback_strategy": {
          "default": "multi_window",
          "description": "Lookback strategy to use for data curation of the baseline. `multi_window` will use a multi-window lookback strategy and is default for OEPRA DIST-S1, `immediate_lookback` will use an immediate lookback strategy using acquisitions preceding the post-date. `immediate_lookback` is not supported yet.",
          "pattern": "^multi_window$",
          "title": "Lookback Strategy",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "post_date_buffer_days": {
          "default": 1,
          "description": "Buffer days around post-date for data collection to create acqusition image to compare baseline to.",
          "maximum": 7,
          "minimum": 0,
          "title": "Post Date Buffer Days",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "model_compilation": {
          "default": false,
          "description": "Whether to compile the model for CPU or GPU. False, use the model as is. True, load the model and compile for CPU or GPU optimizations.",
          "title": "Model Compilation",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "items": {
                "type": "integer"
              },
              "type": "array"
            },
            {
              "type": "null"
            }
          ],
          "default": null,
          "description": "Max number of pre-images per burst within each window",
          "title": "Max Pre Imgs Per Burst Mw"
        },
        "delta_lookback_days_mw": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "items": {
                "type": "integer"
              },
              "type": "array"
            },
            {
              "type": "null"
            }
          ],
          "default": null,
          "description": "Delta lookback days for each window relative to post-image acquisition date",
          "title": "Delta Lookback Days Mw"
        },
        "low_confidence_alert_threshold": {
          "default": 3.5,
          "description": "Low confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
          "maximum": 15.0,
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "title": "Low Confidence Alert Threshold",
          "type": "number"
        },
        "high_confidence_alert_threshold": {
          "default": 5.5,
          "description": "High confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
          "maximum": 15.0,
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "title": "High Confidence Alert Threshold",
          "type": "number"
        },
        "no_day_limit": {
          "default": 30,
          "description": "Number of days to limit confirmation process logic to. Confirmation must occur within first observance of disturbance and `no_day_limit` days after first disturbance.",
          "title": "No Day Limit",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "exclude_consecutive_no_dist": {
          "default": true,
          "description": "Boolean activation of consecutive no disturbance tracking during confirmation. True will apply this logic: after 2 no disturbances within product sequence, the disturbance must finish or be reset. False will not apply this logic.",
          "title": "Exclude Consecutive No Dist",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "percent_reset_thresh": {
          "default": 10,
          "description": "Precentage number threshold to reset disturbance. Values below `percent_reset_thresh` will reset disturbance.",
          "title": "Percent Reset Thresh",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "no_count_reset_thresh": {
          "default": 7,
          "description": "If the number of non-disturbed observations `prevnocount` is above `nocount_reset_thresh` disturbance will reset.",
          "title": "No Count Reset Thresh",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "max_obs_num_year": {
          "default": 253,
          "description": "Max observation number per year. If observations exceeds this number, then the confirmation must conclude and be reset.",
          "title": "Max Obs Num Year",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "confidence_upper_lim": {
          "default": 32000,
          "description": "Confidence upper limit for confirmation. Confidence is an accumulation of the metric over time.",
          "title": "Confidence Upper Lim",
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "confirmation_confidence_threshold": {
          "default": 31.5,
          "description": "This is the threshold for the confirmation process to determine if a disturbance is confirmed.",
          "title": "Confirmation Confidence Threshold",
          "type": "number"
        },
        "metric_value_upper_lim": {
          "default": 100.0,
          "description": "Metric upper limit set during confirmation",
          "title": "Metric Value Upper Lim",
          "type": "number"
        },
        "model_source": {
          "default": "transformer_optimized",
          "description": "Model source. If `external`, use externally supplied paths for weights and config. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
          "title": "Model Source",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "model_cfg_path": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "format": "path",
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "null"
            }
          ],
          "default": null,
          "description": "Path to model config file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
          "title": "Model Cfg Path"
        },
        "model_wts_path": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "format": "path",
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "null"
            }
          ],
          "default": null,
          "description": "Path to model weights file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
          "title": "Model Wts Path"
        },
        "apply_despeckling": {
          "default": true,
          "description": "Whether to apply despeckling to the input data.",
          "title": "Apply Despeckling",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "interpolation_method": {
          "default": "bilinear",
          "description": "Interpolation method to use for despeckling. `nearest` will use nearest neighbor interpolation, `bilinear` will use bilinear interpolation, and `none` will not apply despeckling.",
          "pattern": "^(nearest|bilinear|none)$",
          "title": "Interpolation Method",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "model_dtype": {
          "default": "float32",
          "description": "Data type for model inference. Note: bfloat16 is only supported on GPU devices.",
          "pattern": "^(float32|bfloat16|float)$",
          "title": "Model Dtype",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "use_date_encoding": {
          "default": false,
          "description": "Whether to use acquisition date encoding in model application (currently not supported)",
          "title": "Use Date Encoding",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "n_anniversaries_for_mw": {
          "default": 3,
          "description": "Number of anniversaries to use for multi-window",
          "title": "N Anniversaries For Mw",
          "type": "integer"
        }
      },
      "title": "AlgoConfigData",
      "type": "object"
    },
    "DistS1ProductDirectory": {
      "properties": {
        "product_name": {
          "title": "Product Name",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "dst_dir": {
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "format": "path",
              "type": "string"
            },
            {
              "type": "string"
            }
          ],
          "title": "Dst Dir"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "product_name",
        "dst_dir"
      ],
      "title": "DistS1ProductDirectory",
      "type": "object"
    }
  },
  "properties": {
    "pre_rtc_copol": {
      "description": "List of paths to pre-rtc copolarization data.",
      "items": {
        "anyOf": [
          {
            "format": "path",
            "type": "string"
          },
          {
            "type": "string"
          }
        ]
      },
      "title": "Pre Rtc Copol",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "pre_rtc_crosspol": {
      "description": "List of paths to pre-rtc crosspolarization data.",
      "items": {
        "anyOf": [
          {
            "format": "path",
            "type": "string"
          },
          {
            "type": "string"
          }
        ]
      },
      "title": "Pre Rtc Crosspol",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "post_rtc_copol": {
      "description": "List of paths to post-rtc copolarization data.",
      "items": {
        "anyOf": [
          {
            "format": "path",
            "type": "string"
          },
          {
            "type": "string"
          }
        ]
      },
      "title": "Post Rtc Copol",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "post_rtc_crosspol": {
      "description": "List of paths to post-rtc crosspolarization data.",
      "items": {
        "anyOf": [
          {
            "format": "path",
            "type": "string"
          },
          {
            "type": "string"
          }
        ]
      },
      "title": "Post Rtc Crosspol",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "prior_dist_s1_product": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/$defs/DistS1ProductDirectory"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to prior DIST-S1 product. Can accept str, Path, or DistS1ProductDirectory. If None, no prior product is used and confirmation is not performed."
    },
    "mgrs_tile_id": {
      "description": "MGRS tile ID. Required to kick-off disturbance processing.",
      "title": "Mgrs Tile Id",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "dst_dir": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        }
      ],
      "default": "out",
      "title": "Dst Dir"
    },
    "input_data_dir": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Input data directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.",
      "title": "Input Data Dir"
    },
    "water_mask_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to water mask. If None, no water mask is used.",
      "title": "Water Mask Path"
    },
    "apply_water_mask": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to apply water mask to the input data. If True, water mask is applied to the input data. If no water mask path is provided, the tiles to generate the water mask are localized and formatted for use.",
      "title": "Apply Water Mask",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "check_input_paths": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to check if the input paths exist. If True, the input paths are checked. Used during testing.",
      "title": "Check Input Paths",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "product_dst_dir": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to product directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.",
      "title": "Product Dst Dir"
    },
    "bucket": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Bucket to use for product storage. If None, no bucket is used.",
      "title": "Bucket"
    },
    "bucket_prefix": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Bucket prefix to use for product storage. If None, no bucket prefix is used.",
      "title": "Bucket Prefix"
    },
    "algo_config": {
      "$ref": "#/$defs/AlgoConfigData",
      "description": "Algorithm configuration parameters."
    },
    "algo_config_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to external algorithm config file. If None, no external algorithm config is used.",
      "title": "Algo Config Path"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "pre_rtc_copol",
    "pre_rtc_crosspol",
    "post_rtc_copol",
    "post_rtc_crosspol",
    "mgrs_tile_id"
  ],
  "title": "RunConfigData",
  "type": "object"
}

Config:

  • validate_assignment: True

Fields:

  • pre_rtc_copol (list[Path | str])
  • pre_rtc_crosspol (list[Path | str])
  • post_rtc_copol (list[Path | str])
  • post_rtc_crosspol (list[Path | str])
  • prior_dist_s1_product (DistS1ProductDirectory | None)
  • mgrs_tile_id (str)
  • dst_dir (Path | str)
  • input_data_dir (Path | str | None)
  • water_mask_path (Path | str | None)
  • apply_water_mask (bool)
  • check_input_paths (bool)
  • product_dst_dir (Path | str | None)
  • bucket (str | None)
  • bucket_prefix (str | None)
  • algo_config (AlgoConfigData)
  • algo_config_path (Path | str | None)
  • _burst_ids (list[str] | None)
  • _df_inputs (DataFrame | None)
  • _df_prior_dist_products (DataFrame | None)
  • _df_burst_distmetrics (DataFrame | None)
  • _df_mgrs_burst_lut (GeoDataFrame | None)
  • _product_name (ProductNameData | None)
  • _product_data_model (DistS1ProductDirectory | None)
  • _product_data_model_no_confirmation (DistS1ProductDirectory | None)
  • _min_acq_date (datetime | None)
  • _processing_datetime (datetime | None)
  • _algo_config_loaded (bool)

Validators:

  • convert_to_paths → pre_rtc_copol, pre_rtc_crosspol, post_rtc_copol, post_rtc_crosspol
  • validate_dst_dir → dst_dir
  • validate_product_dst_dir → product_dst_dir
  • validate_input_data_dir → input_data_dir
  • check_matching_lengths_copol_and_crosspol → pre_rtc_crosspol, post_rtc_crosspol
  • check_filename_format → pre_rtc_copol, pre_rtc_crosspol, post_rtc_copol, post_rtc_crosspol
  • validate_mgrs_tile_id → mgrs_tile_id
  • validate_algo_config_path → algo_config_path
  • validate_prior_dist_s1_product → prior_dist_s1_product
  • handle_water_mask_control_flow
  • handle_input_data_dir_default
  • handle_algo_config_loading

docs.title: pre_rtc_copol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to pre-rtc copolarization data.

docs.title: pre_rtc_crosspol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to pre-rtc crosspolarization data.

docs.title: post_rtc_copol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to post-rtc copolarization data.

docs.title: post_rtc_crosspol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to post-rtc crosspolarization data.

docs.title: prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to prior DIST-S1 product. Can accept str, Path, or DistS1ProductDirectory. If None, no prior product is used and confirmation is not performed.

docs.title: mgrs_tile_id: str pydantic-field
docs.text: MGRS tile ID. Required to kick-off disturbance processing.

docs.title: input_data_dir: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_INPUT_DATA_DIR pydantic-field
docs.text: Input data directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.

docs.title: water_mask_path: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to water mask. If None, no water mask is used.

docs.title: apply_water_mask: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_WATER_MASK pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply water mask to the input data. If True, water mask is applied to the input data. If no water mask path is provided, the tiles to generate the water mask are localized and formatted for use.

docs.title: check_input_paths: bool = DEFAULT_CHECK_INPUT_PATHS pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to check if the input paths exist. If True, the input paths are checked. Used during testing.

docs.title: product_dst_dir: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to product directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.

docs.title: bucket: str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Bucket to use for product storage. If None, no bucket is used.

docs.title: bucket_prefix: str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Bucket prefix to use for product storage. If None, no bucket prefix is used.

docs.title: algo_config: AlgoConfigData pydantic-field
docs.text: Algorithm configuration parameters.

docs.title: algo_config_path: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to external algorithm config file. If None, no external algorithm config is used.

docs.title: from_yaml(yaml_file: str) -> RunConfigData classmethod
docs.text: Load configuration from a YAML file and initialize RunConfigModel.

docs.title: convert_to_paths(values: list[Path | str], info: ValidationInfo) -> list[Path] pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert all values to Path objects.

docs.title: validate_input_data_dir(input_data_dir: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert string to Path and validate if provided.

docs.title: check_matching_lengths_copol_and_crosspol(rtc_crosspol: list[Path], info: ValidationInfo) -> list[Path] pydantic-validator
docs.text: Ensure pre_rtc_copol and pre_rtc_crosspol have the same length.

docs.title: check_filename_format(values: Path, field: ValidationInfo) -> None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Check the filename format to ensure correct structure and tokens.

docs.title: validate_mgrs_tile_id(mgrs_tile_id: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that mgrs_tile_id is present in the lookup table.

docs.title: validate_algo_config_path(algo_config_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that algo_config_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_prior_dist_s1_product(prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | Path | str | None) -> DistS1ProductDirectory | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert string or Path to DistS1ProductDirectory using from_product_path if needed.

docs.title: to_yaml(yaml_file: str | Path, algo_param_path: str | Path | None = None) -> None
docs.text:
Save configuration to a YAML file.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default yaml_file str | Path

Path to save the main configuration YAML file

required algo_param_path str | Path | None

If provided, save algorithm parameters to this separate YAML file and reference it in the main config. If None, save all parameters in one file.

None

docs.title: from_product_df(product_df: gpd.GeoDataFrame, dst_dir: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_DST_DIR, apply_water_mask: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_WATER_MASK, water_mask_path: Path | str | None = None, max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw: list[int] | None = None, delta_lookback_days_mw: list[int] | None = None, lookback_strategy: str = 'multi_window', prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | None = None) -> RunConfigData classmethod
docs.text:
Transform input table from dist-s1-enumerator into RunConfigData object.

Algorithm parameters should be assigned via attributes after creation.

docs.title: handle_water_mask_control_flow() -> RunConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Trigger water mask control flow when apply_water_mask is True.

docs.title: handle_input_data_dir_default() -> RunConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Set input_data_dir to dst_dir if None.

docs.title: AlgoConfigData
docs.text:
Base class containing algorithm configuration parameters.

Show JSON schema: 
{
  "description": "Base class containing algorithm configuration parameters.",
  "properties": {
    "device": {
      "default": "best",
      "description": "Device to use for model inference. `best` will use the best available device.",
      "pattern": "^(best|cuda|mps|cpu)$",
      "title": "Device",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "memory_strategy": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "pattern": "^(high|low)$",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": "high",
      "description": "Memory strategy to use for model inference. `high` will use more memory, `low` will use less. Utilizing more memory will improve runtime performance.",
      "title": "Memory Strategy"
    },
    "tqdm_enabled": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to enable tqdm progress bars.",
      "title": "Tqdm Enabled",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 8,
      "description": "Number of workers for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory. Does not work with model compilation or MPS/GPU devices.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "N Workers For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 32,
      "description": "Batch size for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger batch size will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "Batch Size For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "stride_for_norm_param_estimation": {
      "default": 16,
      "description": "Stride for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger stride will improve metric accuracy and utilize more memory.Memory usage scales inverse quadratically with stride. That is, If stride=16 consumes N bytes of memory, then stride=4 consumes 16N bytes of memory.",
      "maximum": 16,
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "Stride For Norm Param Estimation",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "apply_logit_to_inputs": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to apply logit transform to the input data.",
      "title": "Apply Logit To Inputs",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_workers_for_despeckling": {
      "default": 8,
      "description": "Number of workers for despeckling. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.",
      "minimum": 1,
      "title": "N Workers For Despeckling",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "lookback_strategy": {
      "default": "multi_window",
      "description": "Lookback strategy to use for data curation of the baseline. `multi_window` will use a multi-window lookback strategy and is default for OEPRA DIST-S1, `immediate_lookback` will use an immediate lookback strategy using acquisitions preceding the post-date. `immediate_lookback` is not supported yet.",
      "pattern": "^multi_window$",
      "title": "Lookback Strategy",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "post_date_buffer_days": {
      "default": 1,
      "description": "Buffer days around post-date for data collection to create acqusition image to compare baseline to.",
      "maximum": 7,
      "minimum": 0,
      "title": "Post Date Buffer Days",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "model_compilation": {
      "default": false,
      "description": "Whether to compile the model for CPU or GPU. False, use the model as is. True, load the model and compile for CPU or GPU optimizations.",
      "title": "Model Compilation",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "items": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "type": "array"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Max number of pre-images per burst within each window",
      "title": "Max Pre Imgs Per Burst Mw"
    },
    "delta_lookback_days_mw": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "items": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "type": "array"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Delta lookback days for each window relative to post-image acquisition date",
      "title": "Delta Lookback Days Mw"
    },
    "low_confidence_alert_threshold": {
      "default": 3.5,
      "description": "Low confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
      "maximum": 15.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "title": "Low Confidence Alert Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "high_confidence_alert_threshold": {
      "default": 5.5,
      "description": "High confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.",
      "maximum": 15.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "title": "High Confidence Alert Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "no_day_limit": {
      "default": 30,
      "description": "Number of days to limit confirmation process logic to. Confirmation must occur within first observance of disturbance and `no_day_limit` days after first disturbance.",
      "title": "No Day Limit",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "exclude_consecutive_no_dist": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Boolean activation of consecutive no disturbance tracking during confirmation. True will apply this logic: after 2 no disturbances within product sequence, the disturbance must finish or be reset. False will not apply this logic.",
      "title": "Exclude Consecutive No Dist",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "percent_reset_thresh": {
      "default": 10,
      "description": "Precentage number threshold to reset disturbance. Values below `percent_reset_thresh` will reset disturbance.",
      "title": "Percent Reset Thresh",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "no_count_reset_thresh": {
      "default": 7,
      "description": "If the number of non-disturbed observations `prevnocount` is above `nocount_reset_thresh` disturbance will reset.",
      "title": "No Count Reset Thresh",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "max_obs_num_year": {
      "default": 253,
      "description": "Max observation number per year. If observations exceeds this number, then the confirmation must conclude and be reset.",
      "title": "Max Obs Num Year",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "confidence_upper_lim": {
      "default": 32000,
      "description": "Confidence upper limit for confirmation. Confidence is an accumulation of the metric over time.",
      "title": "Confidence Upper Lim",
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "confirmation_confidence_threshold": {
      "default": 31.5,
      "description": "This is the threshold for the confirmation process to determine if a disturbance is confirmed.",
      "title": "Confirmation Confidence Threshold",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "metric_value_upper_lim": {
      "default": 100.0,
      "description": "Metric upper limit set during confirmation",
      "title": "Metric Value Upper Lim",
      "type": "number"
    },
    "model_source": {
      "default": "transformer_optimized",
      "description": "Model source. If `external`, use externally supplied paths for weights and config. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Source",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "model_cfg_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to model config file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Cfg Path"
    },
    "model_wts_path": {
      "anyOf": [
        {
          "format": "path",
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "string"
        },
        {
          "type": "null"
        }
      ],
      "default": null,
      "description": "Path to model weights file. If `external`, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.",
      "title": "Model Wts Path"
    },
    "apply_despeckling": {
      "default": true,
      "description": "Whether to apply despeckling to the input data.",
      "title": "Apply Despeckling",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "interpolation_method": {
      "default": "bilinear",
      "description": "Interpolation method to use for despeckling. `nearest` will use nearest neighbor interpolation, `bilinear` will use bilinear interpolation, and `none` will not apply despeckling.",
      "pattern": "^(nearest|bilinear|none)$",
      "title": "Interpolation Method",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "model_dtype": {
      "default": "float32",
      "description": "Data type for model inference. Note: bfloat16 is only supported on GPU devices.",
      "pattern": "^(float32|bfloat16|float)$",
      "title": "Model Dtype",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "use_date_encoding": {
      "default": false,
      "description": "Whether to use acquisition date encoding in model application (currently not supported)",
      "title": "Use Date Encoding",
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "n_anniversaries_for_mw": {
      "default": 3,
      "description": "Number of anniversaries to use for multi-window",
      "title": "N Anniversaries For Mw",
      "type": "integer"
    }
  },
  "title": "AlgoConfigData",
  "type": "object"
}

Config:

  • validate_assignment: True

docs.title: device: str = DEFAULT_DEVICE pydantic-field
docs.text: Device to use for model inference. best will use the best available device.

docs.title: memory_strategy: str | None = DEFAULT_MEMORY_STRATEGY pydantic-field
docs.text: Memory strategy to use for model inference. high will use more memory, low will use less. Utilizing more memory will improve runtime performance.

docs.title: tqdm_enabled: bool = DEFAULT_TQDM_ENABLED pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to enable tqdm progress bars.

docs.title: n_workers_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_N_WORKERS_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of workers for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory. Does not work with model compilation or MPS/GPU devices.

docs.title: batch_size_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Batch size for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger batch size will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.

docs.title: stride_for_norm_param_estimation: int = DEFAULT_STRIDE_FOR_NORM_PARAM_ESTIMATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Stride for norm parameter estimation from the baseline. Utilizing a larger stride will improve metric accuracy and utilize more memory.Memory usage scales inverse quadratically with stride. That is, If stride=16 consumes N bytes of memory, then stride=4 consumes 16N bytes of memory.

docs.title: apply_logit_to_inputs: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_LOGIT_TO_INPUTS pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply logit transform to the input data.

docs.title: n_workers_for_despeckling: int = DEFAULT_N_WORKERS_FOR_DESPECKLING pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of workers for despeckling. Utilizing more workers will improve runtime performance and utilize more memory.

docs.title: lookback_strategy: str = DEFAULT_LOOKBACK_STRATEGY pydantic-field
docs.text: Lookback strategy to use for data curation of the baseline. multi_window will use a multi-window lookback strategy and is default for OEPRA DIST-S1, immediate_lookback will use an immediate lookback strategy using acquisitions preceding the post-date. immediate_lookback is not supported yet.

docs.title: post_date_buffer_days: int = DEFAULT_POST_DATE_BUFFER_DAYS pydantic-field
docs.text: Buffer days around post-date for data collection to create acqusition image to compare baseline to.

docs.title: model_compilation: bool = DEFAULT_MODEL_COMPILATION pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to compile the model for CPU or GPU. False, use the model as is. True, load the model and compile for CPU or GPU optimizations.

docs.title: max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw: tuple[int, ...] | None = DEFAULT_MAX_PRE_IMGS_PER_BURST_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Max number of pre-images per burst within each window

docs.title: delta_lookback_days_mw: tuple[int, ...] | None = DEFAULT_DELTA_LOOKBACK_DAYS_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Delta lookback days for each window relative to post-image acquisition date

docs.title: low_confidence_alert_threshold: float = DEFAULT_LOW_CONFIDENCE_ALERT_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: Low confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.

docs.title: high_confidence_alert_threshold: float = DEFAULT_HIGH_CONFIDENCE_ALERT_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: High confidence alert threshold for detecting disturbance between baseline and post-image.

docs.title: no_day_limit: int = DEFAULT_NO_DAY_LIMIT pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of days to limit confirmation process logic to. Confirmation must occur within first observance of disturbance and no_day_limit days after first disturbance.

docs.title: exclude_consecutive_no_dist: int = DEFAULT_EXCLUDE_CONSECUTIVE_NO_DIST pydantic-field
docs.text: Boolean activation of consecutive no disturbance tracking during confirmation. True will apply this logic: after 2 no disturbances within product sequence, the disturbance must finish or be reset. False will not apply this logic.

docs.title: percent_reset_thresh: int = DEFAULT_PERCENT_RESET_THRESH pydantic-field
docs.text: Precentage number threshold to reset disturbance. Values below percent_reset_thresh will reset disturbance.

docs.title: no_count_reset_thresh: int = DEFAULT_NO_COUNT_RESET_THRESH pydantic-field
docs.text: If the number of non-disturbed observations prevnocount is above nocount_reset_thresh disturbance will reset.

docs.title: max_obs_num_year: int = DEFAULT_MAX_OBS_NUM_YEAR pydantic-field
docs.text: Max observation number per year. If observations exceeds this number, then the confirmation must conclude and be reset.

docs.title: confidence_upper_lim: int = DEFAULT_CONFIDENCE_UPPER_LIM pydantic-field
docs.text: Confidence upper limit for confirmation. Confidence is an accumulation of the metric over time.

docs.title: confirmation_confidence_threshold: float = DEFAULT_CONFIRMATION_CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD pydantic-field
docs.text: This is the threshold for the confirmation process to determine if a disturbance is confirmed.

docs.title: metric_value_upper_lim: float = DEFAULT_METRIC_VALUE_UPPER_LIM pydantic-field
docs.text: Metric upper limit set during confirmation

docs.title: model_source: str = DEFAULT_MODEL_SOURCE pydantic-field
docs.text: Model source. If external, use externally supplied paths for weights and config. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: model_cfg_path: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_MODEL_CFG_PATH pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to model config file. If external, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: model_wts_path: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_MODEL_WTS_PATH pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to model weights file. If external, use externally supplied path. Otherwise, use distmetrics.model_load.ALLOWED_MODELS for other models.

docs.title: apply_despeckling: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_DESPECKLING pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply despeckling to the input data.

docs.title: interpolation_method: str = DEFAULT_INTERPOLATION_METHOD pydantic-field
docs.text: Interpolation method to use for despeckling. nearest will use nearest neighbor interpolation, bilinear will use bilinear interpolation, and none will not apply despeckling.

docs.title: model_dtype: str = DEFAULT_MODEL_DTYPE pydantic-field
docs.text: Data type for model inference. Note: bfloat16 is only supported on GPU devices.

docs.title: use_date_encoding: bool = DEFAULT_USE_DATE_ENCODING pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to use acquisition date encoding in model application (currently not supported)

docs.title: n_anniversaries_for_mw: int = DEFAULT_N_ANNIVERSARIES_FOR_MW pydantic-field
docs.text: Number of anniversaries to use for multi-window

docs.title: from_yaml(yaml_file: str | Path) -> AlgoConfigData classmethod
docs.text: Load algorithm configuration from a YAML file.

docs.title: validate_device(device: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate and set the device. None or 'none' will be converted to the default device.

docs.title: convert_list_to_tuple(v: list[int] | None) -> tuple[int, ...] | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert lists to tuples for YAML compatibility.

docs.title: serialize_tuple_as_list(v: tuple[int, ...] | None) -> list[int] | None
docs.text: Serialize tuples as lists for YAML compatibility.

docs.title: validate_low_confidence_alert_threshold(low_confidence_alert_threshold: float, info: ValidationInfo) -> float pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that low_confidence_alert_threshold is less than high_confidence_alert_threshold.

docs.title: validate_model_dtype(model_dtype: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_dtype is a supported data type.

docs.title: validate_model_cfg_path(model_cfg_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_cfg_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_model_wts_path(model_wts_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_wts_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_model_compilation_device_compatibility() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that model_compilation is not True when device is 'mps'.

docs.title: validate_model_dtype_device_compatibility() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Warn when bfloat16 is used with non-GPU devices.

docs.title: handle_device_specific_validations() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Handle device-specific validations and adjustments.

docs.title: calculate_max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Calculate max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw if not provided.

docs.title: calculate_delta_lookback_days_mw() -> AlgoConfigData pydantic-validator
docs.text: Calculate delta_lookback_days_mw if not provided.

docs.title: to_yml(yaml_file: str | Path) -> None
docs.text: Save algorithm configuration to a YAML file.

docs.title: RunConfigData
pre_rtc_copol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to pre-rtc copolarization data.

docs.title: pre_rtc_crosspol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to pre-rtc crosspolarization data.

docs.title: post_rtc_copol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to post-rtc copolarization data.

docs.title: post_rtc_crosspol: list[Path | str] pydantic-field
docs.text: List of paths to post-rtc crosspolarization data.

docs.title: prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to prior DIST-S1 product. Can accept str, Path, or DistS1ProductDirectory. If None, no prior product is used and confirmation is not performed.

docs.title: mgrs_tile_id: str pydantic-field
docs.text: MGRS tile ID. Required to kick-off disturbance processing.

docs.title: input_data_dir: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_INPUT_DATA_DIR pydantic-field
docs.text: Input data directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.

docs.title: water_mask_path: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to water mask. If None, no water mask is used.

docs.title: apply_water_mask: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_WATER_MASK pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to apply water mask to the input data. If True, water mask is applied to the input data. If no water mask path is provided, the tiles to generate the water mask are localized and formatted for use.

docs.title: check_input_paths: bool = DEFAULT_CHECK_INPUT_PATHS pydantic-field
docs.text: Whether to check if the input paths exist. If True, the input paths are checked. Used during testing.

docs.title: product_dst_dir: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to product directory. If None, defaults to dst_dir.

docs.title: bucket: str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Bucket to use for product storage. If None, no bucket is used.

docs.title: bucket_prefix: str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Bucket prefix to use for product storage. If None, no bucket prefix is used.

docs.title: algo_config: AlgoConfigData pydantic-field
docs.text: Algorithm configuration parameters.

docs.title: algo_config_path: Path | str | None = None pydantic-field
docs.text: Path to external algorithm config file. If None, no external algorithm config is used.

docs.title: from_yaml(yaml_file: str) -> RunConfigData classmethod
docs.text: Load configuration from a YAML file and initialize RunConfigModel.

docs.title: convert_to_paths(values: list[Path | str], info: ValidationInfo) -> list[Path] pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert all values to Path objects.

docs.title: validate_input_data_dir(input_data_dir: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert string to Path and validate if provided.

docs.title: check_matching_lengths_copol_and_crosspol(rtc_crosspol: list[Path], info: ValidationInfo) -> list[Path] pydantic-validator
docs.text: Ensure pre_rtc_copol and pre_rtc_crosspol have the same length.

docs.title: check_filename_format(values: Path, field: ValidationInfo) -> None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Check the filename format to ensure correct structure and tokens.

docs.title: validate_mgrs_tile_id(mgrs_tile_id: str) -> str pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that mgrs_tile_id is present in the lookup table.

docs.title: validate_algo_config_path(algo_config_path: Path | str | None) -> Path | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Validate that algo_config_path exists if provided.

docs.title: validate_prior_dist_s1_product(prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | Path | str | None) -> DistS1ProductDirectory | None pydantic-validator
docs.text: Convert string or Path to DistS1ProductDirectory using from_product_path if needed.

docs.title: to_yaml(yaml_file: str | Path, algo_param_path: str | Path | None = None) -> None
docs.text:
Save configuration to a YAML file.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default yaml_file str | Path

Path to save the main configuration YAML file

required algo_param_path str | Path | None

If provided, save algorithm parameters to this separate YAML file and reference it in the main config. If None, save all parameters in one file.

None

docs.title: from_product_df(product_df: gpd.GeoDataFrame, dst_dir: Path | str | None = DEFAULT_DST_DIR, apply_water_mask: bool = DEFAULT_APPLY_WATER_MASK, water_mask_path: Path | str | None = None, max_pre_imgs_per_burst_mw: list[int] | None = None, delta_lookback_days_mw: list[int] | None = None, lookback_strategy: str = 'multi_window', prior_dist_s1_product: DistS1ProductDirectory | None = None) -> RunConfigData classmethod

Transform input table from dist-s1-enumerator into RunConfigData object.

Algorithm parameters should be assigned via attributes after creation.

docs.title: handle_input_data_dir_default() -> RunConfigData pydantic-validator
